main event: A metallic unidentified flying object was observed oscillating across the searchlight beam at San Juan International Airport in 1954.
interesting points: The object appeared metallic and had a diameter of about 6 feet., It was first observed at an altitude of approximately 200 feet and descended to around 150 feet., The object did not flash or blink and emitted no sound., The observation lasted for about 2 to 3 minutes., Initial assessment suggested it might be an astronomical meteor.
sighted object: metallic object oscillating in the searchlight beam
